comments:
During sanity check of latest (11/28/06) code in HEAD, I created a project with config file name of faces-configX.xml.   This seems to cause a problem when creating a managed bean using faces config wizard tools.

I have not checked to see if problem exists in 1.5 code line.

java.lang.NullPointerException
	at org.eclipse.jst.jsf.facesconfig.ui.util.ManagedBeanUtil.isBeanDuplicate(ManagedBeanUtil.java:47)
	at org.eclipse.jst.jsf.facesconfig.ui.util.ManagedBeanUtil.getDefaultManagedBeanName(ManagedBeanUtil.java:83)
	at org.eclipse.jst.jsf.facesconfig.ui.wizard.ManagedBeanPropertyPage.initialize(ManagedBeanPropertyPage.java:244)
	at org.eclipse.jst.jsf.facesconfig.ui.wizard.ManagedBeanPropertyPage.setPreviousPage(ManagedBeanPropertyPage.java:217)
	at org.eclipse.jface.wizard.WizardDialog.showPage(WizardDialog.java:1056)
<snip>

DIAGNOSTIC

This bug is due to the fact that parts of the Faces Config Editor make hard-coded assumptions that they are always working on the default faces-config.xml file.  We need to eliminate the default call on the abstract edit to remove any API ability to request a faces-config model without knowing what file it is in.
ManagedBeanUtil.isBeanDuplicate now uses AppConfigManager to determine where the managed beans are that it checks.
